newsitem.title: USA: TET shuts LPG pipeline due to leak.
newsitem.headline: TET shuts LPG pipeline due to leak.

text.p: Texas Eastern Transmission Co said Friday it has shut down one of its two main liquids petroleum gas pipelines because of a minor leak.
The 20-inch Texas to Indiana pipeline, which was carrying propane, was shut down on Thursday following a leak during routine maintenance work, company spokesman Eric Thode said.
"The pipeline had been running at full capacity and (the leak) will put some deliveries behind," Thode said, adding the line will be back up within the next 24 to 48 hours.
The leak occurred in Stoddard County, Mo., along the border with Arkansas.
The pipeline is the larger of two that carry LPGs from Beaumont, Texas, to Seymour, Ind. The smaller 14-inch to 16-inch line runs parellel to the larger 20-inch line.
